question:
In which of the following is the negative end of the bond written last?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. O—S
B. Br—N
C. N—C
D. P—Cl
Answer:

S(s) + O2(g) → SO2(g)
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. either S(s) or O2(g) will be completely used up
B. Q must be close to 1.0 since there is one mole of gas on each side of the equation
C. this reaction goes to completion
D. adding O2 will change the equilibrium constant
Answer:

Cerium(III) sulfate, Ce2(SO4)2, is less soluble in hot water than it is in cold. Which of the following conclusions may be related to this?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The heat of solution of cerium(III) sulfate is exothermic.
B. The hydration energies of cerium ions and sulfate ions are very low.
C. The heat of solution for cerium(III) sulfate is endothermic.
D. The solution is not an ideal solution.
Answer:

A 25 g sample of a liquid was heated to 100 °C and then quickly transferred to an insulated container holding 100 g of water at 22 °C. The temperature of the mixture rose to reach a final temperature of 35 °C. Which of the following can be concluded?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did; therefore the sample lost more heat energy than the water gained.
B. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did, but the sample lost the same amount of heat energy as the water gained.
C. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did; therefore the CP of the sample must be greater than the CP of the water.
D. The final temperature is less than the average starting temperature of the sample and the water; therefore the total energy of the sample and water decreased.
Answer:

Based on periodic relationships, the concepts related to bond strength, and the concept relating bond strength to acid strength, which of the following correctly predicts the strength of binary acids from strongest to weakest?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. H2Se > H2O > H2S
B. H2S > H2Se > H2O
C. H2O < H2S < H2Se
D. H2Se > H2S > H2O
Answer:

Which of the following molecules cannot hydrogen bond with molecules identical to itself but can hydrogen bond with one of the molecules above or below it in the following responses?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CH3CH2OH
B. CH3CH2COOH
C. CH3CH2CHO
D. C6H5CHO
Answer:

A sample of solid MgCl2 would be most soluble in which of the following solutions?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. LiOH(aq)
B. CBr4(aq)
C. Mg(NO3)2(aq)
D. AlCl3(aq)
Answer:

0.25 mol of a weak, monoprotic acid is dissolved in 0.25 L of distilled water. The pH was then measured as 4.26. What is the pKa of this weak acid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 4.26
B. 8.52
C. 7.52
D. 3.66
Answer:

Hard materials such as silicon carbide, used for grinding wheels, are said to be examples of
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. ionic crystals
B. network crystals
C. metallic crystals
D. molecular crystals
Answer:

Which following pair of substances can be used to make a buffer solution?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. NaCl and HCl
B. HC2H3O2 and KC2H3O2
C. NaBr and KBr
D. HIO3 and KClO3
Answer:

The molecule with a tetrahedral shape is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. PCl4F
B. BF3
C. CO2
D. CBr4
Answer:

A solution of a weak base is titrated with a solution of a standard strong acid. The progress of the titration is followed with a pH meter. Which of the following observations would occur?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Initially, the pH slowly decreases, then there is a rapid decrease to give a pH below 7 at the equivalence point.
B. The pH of the solution gradually decreases throughout the experiment and the pH at the equivalence point is below 7.
C. Initially, the pH slowly decreases, then there is a rapid decrease to give a pH equal to 7 at the equivalence point.
D. Initially, the pH quickly decrease, then there is a gradual decrease to the equivalence point where the pOH equals the pKb of the base.
Answer:

What is the molarity of a sodium hydroxide solution that requires 42.6 mL of 0.108 M HCl to neutralize 40.0 mL of the base?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.0641 M
B. 1.64 M
C. 0.115 M
D. 0.400 mol/L
Answer:

A 25 g sample of a solid was heated to 100 °C and then quickly transferred to an insulated container holding 100 g of water at 26 °C. The temperature of the mixture rose to reach a final temperature of 37 °C. Which of the following can be concluded?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The sample lost more thermal energy than the water gained because the sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did.
B. Even though the sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did, the sample lost the same amount of thermal energy as the water gained.
C. The sample temperature changed more than the water temperature did; therefore the heat capacity of the sample must be greater than the heat capacity of the water.
D. The final temperature is less than the average starting temperatures; therefore the equilibrium constant must be less than 1.
Answer:

A stock solution of 12.0 M sulfuric acid is made available. What is the best procedure to make up 100. mL of 4.0 M sulfuric acid using the stock solution and water prior to mixing?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Add 33.3 mL of water to the flask, and then add 66.7 mL of 12.0 M acid.
B. Add 33.3 mL of 12.0 M acid to the flask, and then dilute it with 66.7 mL of water.
C. Add 67.7 mL of 12.0 M acid to the flask, and then dilute it with 33.3 mL of water.
D. Add 67.7 mL of water to the flask, and then add 33.3 mL of 12.0 M acid.
Answer:

Which of the following processes is an irreversible reaction?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CH4(g) + O2(g) → CO2(g) + H2O(l)
B. HCN(aq) + H2O(l) → CN-(aq) + H3O+(aq)
C. Al(NO3)3(s) → Al3+(aq) + 3NO3-(aq)
D. 2Ag+(aq) + Ti(s) → 2Ag(s) + Ti2+(aq)
Answer:

What is the pH of a solution made by dissolving 0.0300 mol of sodium ethanoate in enough water to make 50 mL of solution (Ka for ethanoic acid is 1.8 × 10^-5)?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 7
B. 9.26
C. 4.74
D. 11.02
Answer:

The relationship between the vapor pressure of a liquid and the heat of vaporization is expressed in the
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Rydberg equation
B. Gibbs free energy equation
C. Clausius-Clapeyron equation
D. Arrhenius equation
Answer:

When using the ideal gas law, standard conditions for temperature and pressure are
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0 K and 0 torr
B. 25 °C and 1 atmosphere pressure
C. 0 °C and 760 torr
D. 0 °F and 1 atmosphere pressure
Answer:

0.0025 mol of a weak, monoprotic acid is dissolved in 0.250 L of distilled water. The pH was then measured as 4.26. What is the pKa of this weak acid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 4.26
B. 8.52
C. 7.92
D. 6.52
Answer:

Carbon exists in various forms called allotropes. Which of the following is not an allotrope of carbon?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. diamond
B. soot
C. buckminsterfullerene
D. graphite
Answer:

The bond length between any two nonmetal atoms is achieved under which of the following conditions?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Where the energy of interaction between the atoms is at its minimum value
B. Where the nuclei of each atom exhibits the strongest attraction to the electrons of the other atom
C. The point at which the attractive and repulsive forces between the two atoms are equal
D. The closest point at which a valence electron from one atom can transfer to the other atom
Answer:

Monatomic ions of the representative elements are often
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. very soluble
B. very electronegative
C. isoelectronic with a noble gas
D. highly colored
Answer:

Bromine has a normal boiling point of 59 °C, and iodine boils at 184 °C. The I2 molecule is much larger than Br2 (atomic radii are 114 and 133 pm, respectively). Which is the best reason for the large difference in boiling points?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Bromine is a liquid and boils; iodine is a solid and sublimes.
B. The intramolecular bonds in I2 are much weaker than those in Br2.
C. The I2 electron clouds are much more polarizable than the Br2 electron clouds, resulting in much stronger London forces.
D. The mass of iodine is much greater than the mass of bromine.
Answer:

What is the molecular mass of a gas that has a density of 2.05 g/L at 26.0 °C and 722 torr?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 53.0 g/mol
B. 46.7 g/mol
C. 4.67 g/mol
D. 2876 g/mol
Answer:

Which of the following is the correct order of increasing acid strength?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. H2SeO3 < H2SO3 < HClO < HBrO
B. HClO < H2SeO3 < HBrO < H2SO3
C. HBrO < HClO < H2SeO3 < H2SO3
D. H2SO3 < H2SeO3 < HClO < HBrO
Answer:

Argon can be liquefied at low temperature because of
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. dipole-dipole attractive forces
B. hydrogen bonding
C. instantaneous and induced dipoles
D. the very low temperature
Answer:

A solution is prepared by dissolving 30.0 grams of Ni(NO3)2 in enough water to make 250 mL of solution. What is the molarity of this solution?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 0.496 molar
B. 0.656 mol/L
C. 3.3 molar
D. 6.3 × 10^-3 molar
Answer:

Each resonance form of the nitrate ion, NO3-, has how many sigma and how many pi bonds?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1 sigma and 2 pi
B. 2 sigma and 1 pi
C. 1 sigma and 1 pi
D. 3 sigma and 1 pi
Answer:

The first ionization energy for a neutral atom of chlorine is 1.25 MJ/mol and the first ionization energy for a neutral atom of argon is 1.52 MJ/mol. How would the first ionization energy value for a neutral atom of potassum compare to those values?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. It would be greater than both because potassium carries a greater nuclear charge then either chlorine or argon.
B. It would be greater than both because the size of a potassium atom is smaller than an atom of either chlorine or argon.
C. It would be less than both because there are more electrons in potassium, meaning they repel each other more effectively and less energy is needed to remove one.
D. It would be less than both because a valence electron of potassium is farther from the nucleus than one of either chlorine or argon.
Answer:

When potassium perchlorate, KClO4, dissolves in water, the temperature of the resultant solution is lower than the initial temperature of the components. Which of the following conclusions may be related to this?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. This is a spontaneous process because it is exothermic.
B. This is a spontaneous process because of an entropy increase.
C. This is a spontaneous process because of an entropy decrease.
D. This is a spontaneous process because it is exothermic.
Answer:

The oxidation number of chlorine in the perchlorate ion, ClO4–, is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2
B. -3
C. -1
D. 7
Answer:

A first-order reaction has a half-life of 34 minutes. What is the rate constant for this reaction?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3.4 × 10^-4 s-1
B. 2.04 × 10^-2 s-1
C. 2.9 × 10^-1 min-1
D. 34 min
Answer:

A student has a liter of a 0.100 M solution of a strong acid. To prepare a buffer, this should be mixed with
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. a strong acid
B. a weak acid
C. a weak base
D. a strong base
Answer:

Neutral atoms of chlorine are bombarded by high-energy photons, causing the ejection of electrons from the various filled subshells. Electrons originally from which subshell would have the highest velocity after being ejected?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1s
B. 2p
C. 3p
D. 3d
Answer:

A 2.0 L flask holds 0.40 g of helium gas. If the helium is evacuated into a larger container while the temperature is held constant, what will the effect on the entropy of the helium be?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. It will remain constant as the number of helium molecules does not change.
B. It will decrease as the gas will be more ordered in the larger flask.
C. It will decrease because the molecules will collide with the sides of the larger flask less often than they did in the smaller flask.
D. It will increase as the gas molecules will be more dispersed in the larger flask.
Answer:

Chemists often ascribe the macroscopic properties of solids to the underlying microscopic structure. Silicon carbide is almost as hard and brittle as diamond. The solid state structure of silicon carbide is often described as
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. a molecular crystal
B. a covalent or network crystal
C. a metallic crystal
D. an ionic crystal
Answer:

Which of the following correctly lists the individual intermolecular attractive forces from the strongest to the weakest?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Induced dipole < dipole-dipole < hydrogen bond
B. Hydrogen bond < dipole-dipole < induced dipole
C. Induced dipole < hydrogen bond < dipole-dipole
D. Dipole-dipole < hydrogen bond < induced dipole
Answer:

Nitrogen's electronegativity value is between those of phosphorus and oxygen. Which of the following correctly describes the relationship between the three values?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The value for nitrogen is less than that of phosphorus because nitrogen is larger, but greater than that of oxygen because nitrogen has a greater effective nuclear charge.
B. The value for nitrogen is less than that of phosphorus because nitrogen has fewer protons but greater than that of oxygen because nitrogen has less valence electrons.
C. The value for nitrogen is greater than that of phosphorus because nitrogen has less electrons, but less than that of oxygen because nitrogen is smaller.
D. The value for nitrogen is greater than that of phosphorus because nitrogen is smaller, but less than that of oxygen because nitrogen has a smaller effective nuclear charge.
Answer:

Determine the H+(aq) concentration in 1.0 M phenol, C6H5OH, solution. (The Ka for phenol is 1 × 10^-10.)
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1 × 10^-10 M
B. 1 × 10^-9 M
C. 1 × 10^-3 M
D. 1 × 10^-5 M
Answer:

How many milliliters of 0.250 M KOH does it take to neutralize completely 50.0 mL of 0.150 M H3PO4?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 30.0 mL
B. 27 mL
C. 90.0 mL
D. 270 mL
Answer:

Radon is a health hazard because
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. it is a gas that can be inhaled and then it may decay to a solid that resides in the lungs
B. it is a gas that is extremely soluble in the bloodstream, and it decays in vital organs
C. it is a gas that enters the body easily and targets the thyroid because it is chemically similar to iodine
D. it is a gas that enters the body easily and targets bones because it is chemically similar to calcium
Answer:

Chlorine is often used to oxidize other substances. It makes a good bleach because it can oxidize many colored compounds. If chlorine is not available, what other substance can be used for oxidizing substances?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Al
B. H2S
C. Zn
D. KMnO4
Answer:

Atoms of four elements are examined: carbon, nitrogen, neon, and sulfur. Atoms of which element are most likely to form a structure with the formula XF6 (where X is one of the four atoms)?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Carbon
B. Nitrogen
C. Neon
D. Sulfur
Answer:

During the study of the reaction A → 2B, a chemist constructs several graphs. The graph of [A] versus time and the graph of ln [A] versus time both give a curved line; however, the graph of 1/[A] versus time and gives a straight line. This implies the rate law is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Rate = k[A]
B. Rate = k[A]^2
C. Rate = k[A]^0
D. Rate = k[A]^-1
Answer:

Under which conditions will a real gas most closely behave as an ideal gas?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. High temperature and high pressure
B. High temperature and low pressure
C. High volume and high temperature
D. Low temperature and low pressure
Answer:

Which would be the easiest way to burn an iron nail?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Hold an iron nail with crucible tongs, and heat strongly in the flame of a Bunsen burner.
B. Use the method in (A), but use an oxyacetylene torch to reach a higher temperature.
C. Grind the nail into very small, dust-sized particles, and spray them into a flame
D. Dissolve the nail in acid to make the oxide.
Answer:

The units for R, the ideal gas law equation constant, may be
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. L atm mol-1 K-1
B. J mol-1 K-1
C. volt coulomb mol-1 K-1
D. (A), (B), and (C)
Answer:

A certain radioactive material has a half-life of 36 minutes. Starting with 10.00 grams of this material, how many grams will be left after 2 hours?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1.00 grams
B. 1.5 × 10^-4 grams
C. 3.33 grams
D. 0.25 gram
Answer:

The most massive subatomic particle is the
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. proton
B. neutron
C. alpha particle
D. beta particle
Answer:

Consider the Lewis structures for the following molecules: CO2, CO32-, NO2-, and NO3-. Which molecule would have the shortest bonds?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CO2
B. CO32-
C. NO2-
D. NO3-
Answer:

Hydrogen fluoride, HF, is a liquid at 15°C. All other hydrogen halides (represented by HX, where X is any other halogen) are gases at the same temperature. Why?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Fluorine has a very high electronegativity; therefore the H-F bond is stronger than any other H-X bond.
B. HF is smaller than any other H-X molecule; therefore it exhibits stronger London dispersion forces.
C. The dipoles in a HF molecule exhibit a particularly strong attraction force to the dipoles in other HF molecules.
D. The H-F bond is the most ionic in character compared to all other hydrogen halides.
Answer:

Of the following, the most important experimental information used to deduce the structure of the atom was
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. the density of each element
B. the specific heat capacity
C. the emission spectrum of the elements, particularly hydrogen
D. the X-rays emitted from each element
Answer:

What is the pH of a solution prepared by dissolving 0.1665 mole of hypochlorous acid (HClO) in enough water to make 500 mL of solution? The Ka is 3.0 × 10^-4
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1
B. 2
C. 5.4 × 10^-3
D. 1.76
Answer:

Starting with a stock solution of 18.0 M H2SO4, what is the proper procedure to create a 1.00 L sample of a 3.0 M solution of H2SO4 in a volumetric flask?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Add 167 mL of the stock solution to the flask, then fill the flask the rest of the way with distilled water while swirling the solution.
B. Add 600 mL of the stock solution to the flask, then fill the flask the rest of the way with distilled water while swirling the solution.
C. Fill the flask partway with water, then add 167 mL of the stock solution, swirling to mix it. Last, fill the flask the rest of the way with distilled water.
D. Fill the flask partway with water, then add 600 mL of the stock solution, swirling to mix it. Last, fill the flask the rest of the way with distilled water.
Answer:

When the dichromate ion is reacted, one of its most common products is Cr3+. What is the oxidation state (oxidation number) of chromium in the dichromate ion? Does reduction or oxidation occur when dichromate forms Cr3+?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 3+, reduction
B. 12+, reduction
C. 6+, reduction
D. 6+, oxidation
Answer:

Which of the following is considered a metalloid?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Cr
B. Mn
C. Si
D. S
Answer:

The photoelectron spectrum of carbon has three equally sized peaks. What peak is at the lowest energy?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. The 1s peak has the lowest energy.
B. The 2s peak has the lowest energy.
C. The 2p peak has the lowest energy.
D. The 1p peak has the lowest energy.
Answer:

Which of the following reactions is expected to have the greatest decrease in entropy?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. HCl(aq) + NaOH(aq) → NaCl(aq) + H2O(l)
B. CH4(g) + 2 O2(g) → CO2(g) + 2 H2O(l)
C. C(s) + O2(g) → CO2(g)
D. 2 SO2(g) + O2(g) → 2 SO3(g)
Answer:

Chemical reactions can be classified as either heterogeneous or homogeneous. Which of the following equations below is best classified as a heterogeneous reaction?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2C2H2(g) + 5O2(g) → 4CO2(g) + 2H2O(g)
B. C2H5OH(aq) + O2(aq) → HC2H3O2(aq) + H2O(aq)
C. C(s) + H2O(g) → H2(g) + CO(g)
D. C2H2(g) + 5N2O(g) → CO2(g) + H2O(g) + 5N2(g)
Answer:

When will Kp and Kc have the same numerical value?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. At absolute zero for all reactions
B. When the concentrations are at standard state
C. When the concentrations are all 1.00 molar
D. When the reaction exhibits no change in pressure at constant volume
Answer:

An unknown substance is found to have a high melting point. In addition, it is a poor conductor of electricity and does not dissolve in water. The substance most likely contains
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. ionic bonding
B. nonpolar covalent bonding
C. covalent network bonding
D. metallic bonding
Answer:

The name for CH3CHBrCHClCH2CH3 is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. dibromotrichloropropane
B. dibromotrichloropentane
C. 2-bromo, 3-chloropentane
D. 2,3-bromochloropentane
Answer:

Which of the following molecules is a strong electrolyte when dissolved in water?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CH3COOH
B. HC2H3O2
C. PCl5
D. HBr
Answer:

During a chemical reaction, NO(g) gets reduced and no nitrogen-containing compound is oxidized. Which of the following is a possible product of this reaction?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. NO2(g)
B. N2(g)
C. NO3-(aq)
D. NO2-(aq)
Answer:

A sample of a compound known to consist of only carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen is found to have a total mass of 29.05 g. If the mass of the carbon is 18.02 g and the mass of the hydrogen is 3.03 g, what is the empirical formula of the compound?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. C2H4O
B. C3H6O
C. C2H6O3
D. C3H8O2
Answer:

Which of the following is a balanced chemical reaction?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Na2SO4 + Ba(NO3)2 → BaSO4 + NaSO4
B. AgNO3 + K2CrO4 → Ag2CrO4 + 2 KNO3
C. 5 FeCl2 + 8 HCl + KMnO4 → 5 FeCl3 + MnCl2 + 4 H2O + KCl
D. Al(NO3)3 + 3 KOH → Al(OH)3 + KNO3
Answer:

The ideal gas law is successful for most gases because
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. room temperature is high
B. volumes are small
C. gas particles do not interact significantly
D. gases are dimers
Answer:

S(s) + O2(g) → SO2(g)
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. one atom of S reacts with one molecule of O2 to yield one molecule of SO2
B. one mole of sulfur atoms reacts with one mole of oxygen molecules to yield one mole of sulfur dioxide molecules
C. this reaction goes to completion
D. adding S(s) will change the equilibrium constant
Answer:

Which of the following substances has an asymmetrical molecular structure?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. SF4
B. PCl5
C. BF3
D. CO2
Answer:

Which would be the easiest way to burn a copper penny?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Hold the copper penny with crucible tongs, and heat strongly in the flame of a Bunsen burner.
B. Use the method in (A), but use an oxyacetylene torch to reach a higher temperature.
C. Grind the copper penny into very small, dust-sized particles, and spray the particles into a Bunsen burner flame.
D. Dissolve the copper penny in acid, precipitate the hydroxide, and heat in a Bunsen burner flame to make the oxide.
Answer:

Which of the following can form hydrogen bonds?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. CH3OCH2CH3
B. HCN
C. CH3OCH2Br
D. CH3NH2
Answer:

An ideal solution is a
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. mixture where two solvents can be dissolved in all ratios
B. mixture that has the same physical properties as the individual solvents
C. mixture where the potential energy of the mixture is the same as that of the individual solvents
D. mixture that is colorless
Answer:

Sulfur dioxide reacts with oxygen to form sulfur trioxide in the presence of a catalyst. The equilibrium constant, Kp, at a certain temperature is 3.0 × 10^22. A 2.0-liter flask has enough SO3 added to it to produce a pressure of 0.789 atm Hg. After the reaction comes to equilibrium, the expected partial pressure of O2 will be
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 2.88 × 10^-6 torr
B. 3 × 10^-18 mm Hg
C. 1100 mm Hg
D. 1.32 × 10^-5 torr
Answer:

Which net ionic equation below represents a possible reaction that takes place when a strip of magnesium metal is oxidized by a solution of chromium (III) nitrate?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Mg(s) + Cr(NO3)3(aq) → Mg2+(aq) + Cr3+(aq) + 3NO3-(aq)
B. 3Mg(s) + 2Cr3+ → 3Mg2+ + 2Cr(s)
C. Mg(s) + Cr3+ → Mg2+ + Cr(s)
D. 3Mg(s) + 2Cr(NO3)3(aq) → 3Mg2+(aq) + 2Cr(s) + NO3-(aq)
Answer:

Sulfurous acid is a weak acid, while sulfuric acid is a much stronger acid because
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. the sulfur in sulfuric acid is more electronegative than the sulfur in sulfurous acid
B. sulfuric acid has more oxygen atoms in its formula
C. the O–H bonds in sulfuric acid are much weaker than those in sulfurous acid
D. sulfurous acid has its hydrogen atoms bound directly to the sulfur atom
Answer:

The rate law may be written using stoichiometric coefficients for which of the following?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. Precipitation reactions
B. Acid-base reactions
C. Elementary processes
D. Solubility reactions
Answer:

para-dichlorobenzene is used as "mothballs." This compound can also be named
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. 1,2-dichlorobenzene
B. 1,3-dichlorobenzene
C. 2,4-dichlorobenzene
D. 1,4-dichlorobenzene
Answer:

Which of the following is true for all bases?
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. All bases donate OH- ions into solution.
B. Only strong bases create solutions in which OH- ions are present.
C. Only strong bases are good conductors when dissolved in solution.
D. For weak bases, the concentration of the OH-ions exceeds the concentration of the base in the solution.
Answer:

The melting point of straight-chain hydrocarbons increases as the number of carbon atoms increase. The reason for this is the
Choose the best answer from the following options:
A. increasing mass of the compounds
B. increasing polarity of the compounds
C. increasing number of induced dipoles per molecule
D. increased probability of hydrogen bonds
Answer:

The net ionic equation expected when solutions of NH4Br and AgNO3 are mixed together is
Choose the best answer from the following options:
